intro: Seseli varium, commonly known as the narrowleaf seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. Native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe, it thrives in rocky and dry habitats. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often mistaken for other members of its family. It is typically found in alpine meadows and is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
